army.name: T9A Warriors o.t. Dark Gods
army.description: T9A Warriors of the Dark Gods

unit.name: Exalted Herald
unit.description: single model, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 50x50 mm, Fear, Fearless, Manifestation, Supernal, Wizard Adept, Aegis (4+)

unit.name: Chosen Lord
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Hell-Forged Armour

unit.name: Doomlord
unit.description: single model, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 40x40 mm, Fearless, Master of Destruction, Path of the Exiled, Hell-Forged Armour

unit.name: Sorcerer
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Battle Fever, Light Armour

unit.name: Barbarian Chief
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Battle Fever, Heavy Armour, Deeds not Words

unit.name: Feldrak Ancestor
unit.description: single model, Height Gigantic, Type Beast, Base 75x100 mm, Primal Legend, Unburnt, Light Armour, Breath Attack (Str 4, AP 1, Dying Embers, Flaming Attacks), Hatred (against Fly)

unit.name: Warriors
unit.description: 10-25 models, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Scoring, Hell-Forged Armour, Spiked Shield

unit.name: Fallen
unit.description: 5-15 models, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Fearless, Light Troops, Path of the Exiled, Hell-Forged Armour, Paired Weapons

unit.name: Barbarians
unit.description: 15-40 models, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Battle Fever, Scoring, Light Armour

unit.name: Barbarian Horsemen (Core)
unit.description: 5-15 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Battle Fever, Scoring, Heavy Armour, Black Steed: Harnessed

unit.name: Warhounds (Core)
unit.description: 5-15 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Beast, Base 25x50 mm, Insignificant, Release the Hounds

unit.name: Barbarian Horsemen
unit.description: 5-15 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Battle Fever, Scoring, Heavy Armour, Black Steed: Harnessed

unit.name: Warhounds
unit.description: 5-15 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Beast, Base 25x50 mm, Insignificant, Release the Hounds

unit.name: Warrior Knights
unit.description: 5-10 models, 0-5 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Scoring, Hell-Forged Armour, Shield, Black Steed: Harnessed

unit.name: Warrior Chariot
unit.description: single model, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Swiftstride, Hell-Forged Armour, Warrior Crew (2): Halberd, Black Steed (2): Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6+1), Inanimate

unit.name: Chosen
unit.description: 5-10 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Scoring, Hell-Forged Armour, Spiked Shield, Master of Battle

unit.name: Chosen Knights
unit.description: 3-5 models, 0-12 Models/Army, Height Large, Type Cavalry, Base 50x75 mm, Fear, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Scoring, Hell-Forged Armour, Chosen Rider: Halberd, Karkadan: Harnessed

unit.name: Chosen Chariot
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Fear, Fearless, Path of the Favoured, Swiftstride, Hell-Forged Armour, Chosen Crew (2): Halberd, Karkadan: Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6+1), Inanimate

unit.name: Chimera
unit.description: single model, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Beast, Base 50x100 mm, Fear, Towering Presence

unit.name: Wretched Ones
unit.description: 1-6 models, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 40x40 mm, Fearless, Irredeemable, Random Movement (3D6"), Unbreakable, Fortitude (5+), Grind Attacks (D6+1)

unit.name: Forsworn
unit.description: 3-9 models, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 40x40 mm, Bodyguard (Doomlord), Fearless, Path of the Exiled, Scoring, Hell-Forged Armour

unit.name: Feldraks
unit.description: 3-6 models, Height Large, Type: Beast, Base 50x75 mm, Fear, Scoring, Unburnt, Light Armour, Hatred (against Fly)

unit.name: Battleshrine
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Battle Fever, Beacon of the Dark Gods, Channel (1), Fear, Not a Leader, Towering Presence, Trophy Rack, War Platform, Wizard Apprentice, Aegis (5+), Wretched One (2): Grind Attacks (D6+1), Harnessed

unit.name: Flayers
unit.description: 5-10 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Battle Fever, Feigned Flight, Light Troops, Strider, Vanguard (6"), Light Armour, Shadow Chaser: Harnessed

unit.name: Hellmaw
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Construct, Base 100x150 mm, Fearless, Gateway, Supernal, Aegis (5+)

unit.name: Forsaken One
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Beast, Base 50x100 mm, Fearless, Irredeemable, Random Movement (3D6"), Unbreakable, Fortitude (5+), Grind Attacks (D6+3)

unit.name: Marauding Giant
unit.description: single model, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Infantry, Base 50x75 mm, Giant See Giant Do, Rage

unit.name: Feldrak Elder
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Beast, Base 50x100 mm, Unburnt, Light Armour, Hatred (against Fly)

mount.name: Black Steed
mount.description: Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Harnessed

mount.name: Shadow Chaser
mount.description: Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Light Troops, Strider, Vanguard (6"), Harnessed

mount.name: Scythed Skywheel
mount.description: Height Standard, Type Construct, Base 50x50 mm, Fly (6", 18"), Light Troops, Swiftstride, Tall, Cannot be Stomped, Hard Target (1), Grind Attacks (D3+1), Harnessed

mount.name: War Dais
mount.description: Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 50x50 mm, Tall, Cannot be Stomped, Harnessed

mount.name: Dark Chariot
mount.description: 0-3 Mounts/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Swiftstride, Black Steed (2): Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6+1), Inanimate

mount.name: Battleshrine
mount.description: 0-1 Mounts/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Channel (1), Fear, Keeper of the Beacon, Towering Presence, Trophy Rack, War Platform, Aegis (5+), Wretched One (2): Grind Attacks (D6+1), Harnessed

mount.name: Karkadan
mount.description: Height Large, Type Cavalry, Base 50x75 mm, Fear, Harnessed

mount.name: Chimera
mount.description: 0-2 Mounts/Army, Height Large, Type Cavalry, Base 50x100 mm, Fear, Towering Presence, Harnessed

mount.name: Wasteland Behemoth
mount.description: 0-2 Mounts/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Beast, Base 100x150 mm, Harnessed

mount.name: Wasteland Dragon
mount.description: Height Gigantic, Type Beast, Base 50x100 mm, Fly (6", 12"), Light Troops, Breath Attack (Str 4, AP 1, Flaming Attacks), Harnessed

item.name: Favours of the Dark Gods
item.description: A Character with a Favour cannot join a unit that contains any models with a different Favour.

item.name: Envy
Favour of Kuulima, Goddess of Envy
item.description: Attack Attribute - Close Combat The model gains Swiftstride. In addition, a Charging model part with this Attack Attribute must reroll any natural to-hit rolls of 1. Units with all of their models with this Favour must reroll any natural rolls of 1 when rolling for Charge Range.

item.name: Gluttony
Favour of Akaan, God of Gluttony
item.description: Attack Attribute - Close Combat The first time a model with this Favour successfully Charges a Fleeing unit, or is on the winning side of a combat and does not Pursue or Overrun, its Close Combat Attacks from model parts with this Favour gain +1 Strength (the effect lasts for the duration of the game).

item.name: Greed
Favour of Sugulag, God of Greed
item.description: Universal Rule The bearer gains Great Weapon, Halberd, Paired Weapons, and Weapon Master. The Special Item allowance of Characters with this Favour is increased by 50 pts.

item.name: Lust
Favour of Cibaresh, God of Lust
item.description: Universal Rule The model gains Strider. In addition, units with more than half of their models with this Favour are subject to the following rules: - They gain Feigned Flight. - They may declare Flee as a Charge Reaction even if they have Fearless. - Their Rally Test in their next Player Turn after voluntarily declaring Flee as a Charge Reaction is subject to Minimised Roll. This does not apply if a unit fails to rally on the next friendly Player Turn or Flees involuntarily.

item.name: Pride
Favour of Savar, God of Pride
item.description: Universal Rule Discipline Tests taken by units with at least one model with this Favour are subject to Minimised Roll.

item.name: Sloth
Favour of Nukuja, Goddess of Sloth
item.description: Universal Rule Models with this Favour gain +1 Resilience. If a model with this Favour declares a Charge against an enemy unit that is more than 10"* away or performs an Advance or March Move of more than 10"*, this effect is lost until the start of the Melee Phase in the next Player Turn. *These distances are decreased to 6" if the model is Gigantic.

item.name: Wrath
Favour of Vanadra, Goddess of Wrath
item.description: Attack Attribute - Close Combat The model part gains Lightning Reflexes and +1 Agility. Close Combat Attacks allocated towards the model gain +1 to hit. These effects are only applied in the First Round of Combat.

item.name: Battle Fever
item.description: Units with more than half of their models with Battle Fever must reroll failed Panic and Break Tests. AMR

item.name: Irredeemable
item.description: The model cannot make Stomp Attacks and, when in the second rank and not in base contact with any enemy models, can make Grind Attacks across models in the first rank directly in front of it. When a model with Irredeemable is killed by a Melee Attack, remove it as a casualty only at the end of Initiative Step 0. A unit with at least one model with Irredeemable may never have more ranks than files.

item.name: Path of the Exiled
item.description: Units with more than half of their models with Path of the Exiled must reroll failed Break Tests. At the end of step 7 of a Round of Combat (after taking Break Tests), models with Path of the Exiled in a unit that failed a Break Test simultaneously perform Close Combat Attacks (ignoring the rules for Initiative Order, but otherwise following the normal rules such as Supporting Attacks and Allocating Attacks). Afterwards, they are removed as casualties. Models with Path of the Exiled cannot join or be joined by models with Path of the Favoured.

item.name: Path of the Favoured
item.description: Units with more than half of their models with Path of the Favoured must reroll failed Break Tests. In addition, model parts with Path of the Favoured upgraded to a Champion gain +1 Health Point to a maximum of 3, and their Discipline is set to 9.

item.name: Trophy Rack
item.description: The bearers unit may reroll failed Discipline Tests unless Fleeing. Each time attacks made by the bearers model kill an enemy model in a Duel, the bearers model gains a +1 Combat Score modifier for the rest of the game (this also applies to attacks made outside the Melee Phase). In addition, the bearers model may take a single Banner Enchantment (using the bearers Special Item allowance as normal).

item.name: Veil Walker
item.description: When a model with Veil Walker casts a non-Bound Spell, you may discard a single Veil Token when declaring the target(s) of the spell and activate one of the following effects: - Secret of Flesh: Failed to-wound rolls from this spell that occur during a Magic Phase must be rerolled. - Secret of Separation: The spells range is increased by 6". Aura spells only gain +3" range. Spells with type Caster are unaffected. - Secret of Substance: Successful Armour Saves against wounds caused by this spells effect must be rerolled.

item.name: Unburnt
item.description: Successful to-wound rolls of attacks that are Flaming Attacks made against the model must be rerolled. In addition, the model considers all units consisting entirely of models without Unburnt as Insignificant.

item.name: Hell-Forged Armour
item.description: Armour Equipment. Follows the rules for Plate Armour (can be enchanted as if it was Plate Armour). The wearers model gains Aegis (5+, against Toxic Attacks).

item.name: Spiked Shield
item.description: Armour Equipment. Models on foot only. Follows the rules for Shields (can be enchanted as if it was a Shield). For each successful Armour Save roll of 4+ made by the bearer against a Melee Attack while using a Spiked Shield, the model that caused the wound immediately suffers 1 hit with the bearers Strength and Armour Penetration, before any casualties are removed, distributed onto the models Health Pool. This is considered a Special Attack.

item.name: Burning Portent
item.description: Enchantment: Hand Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon become Flaming Attacks and Magical Attacks, gain Multiple Wounds (D3), and their Armour Penetration is set to 10.

item.name: Symbol of Slaughter
item.description: Enchantment: Hand Weapon and Paired Weapons. When using this weapon, the wielder gains +2 Attack Value, +2 Agility, and Magical Attacks. Close Combat Attacks made against the wielders model gain +1 to hit.

item.name: Thrice-Forged
item.description: Enchantment: Suit of Armour. The wearer gains +3 Armour. If the wearers model has Towering Presence, its Armour cannot be improved beyond 5.

item.name: Gladiators Spirit
item.description: Enchantment: Suit of Armour. The wearer gains +1 Armour and Parry.

item.name: Zealots Banner
item.description: 0-3 per Army. The maximum number of Supporting Attacks that models in the second rank of the bearers unit can perform is increased by 1.

item.name: Icon of the Infinite
item.description: 0-2 per Army. Cannot be taken by units that count towards Core. The bearer of one or more Icons of the Infinite can cast Hellfire (Hereditary Spell) as a Bound Spell with Power Level (4/8).

item.name: Wasteland Torch
item.description: The bearers unit gains Strider (Ruins). After determining Deployment Zones (at the end of step 6 of the Pre-Game Sequence), you may choose a single Field or Forest Terrain Feature that becomes Ruins. The bearers unit gains Flaming Attacks in the First Round of Combat.

item.name: Ledger of Souls
item.description: Dominant. Immediately before removing a friendly model without Insignificant in a unit within 9" of the bearers model due to enemy attacks, you gain one Veil Token for each Health Point that model had the first time it entered the Battlefield.

item.name: Immortal Gauntlets
item.description: At the start of any Round of Combat, you may discard a Veil Token from your Veil Token pool. If so, choose either Divine Attacks, Flaming Attacks, or Magical Attacks. The bearers Close Combat Attacks gain the chosen Attack Attribute. The chosen effect lasts until the end of the phase.

item.name: Lord of the Damned
item.description: Sorcerers, Doomlords, and Shrine Priests only. Any unit with Irredeemable within 18" of the bearers model may reroll the distance it moves in the Movement Phase with Random Movement.

item.name: Wyrd Stone
item.description: One use only. Must be activated when the bearers model suffers the first hit in the game. This hit is ignored. If the bearer is hit by several simultaneous attacks, the bearer chooses which attack to ignore.

item.name: Veilgate Orb
item.description: At the end of Siphon the Veil, the army may keep up to 6 Veil Tokens instead of the normal 3.

item.name: Manifestation
item.description: Universal Rule. During Spell Selection, each Exalted Herald must choose two different Manifestations from the list below and apply the effects during the game. The model must select 3 spells out of the spells indicated for the chosen Manifestations, Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy), and Hellfire (Hereditary Spell). This replaces the normal rules for Spell Selection connected to being a Wizard Adept. In addition, Guiding Light (Divination) becomes the Attribute Spell for all non-Bound Spells cast by the model.

item.name: Abiding Spirit
item.description: Hard Target (1). At the end of each friendly Melee Phase, if the Exalted Herald has been on the winning side of a combat in this phase, it Recovers 1 Health Point. The Exalted Herald has access to Smite the Unbeliever (Thaumaturgy).

item.name: Brand of the Dragon
item.description: Breath Attack (Str 4, AP 1, Flaming Attacks), Fly (8", 16"), Light Troops, and Swiftstride. The Exalted Herald has access to Breath of Corruption (Occultism).

item.name: Emissary of Chaos
item.description: Stomp Attacks (D6), Stubborn, Tall, and Terror. The Exalted Herald has access to Pentagram of Pain (Occultism).

item.name: Sorcerer Immortal
item.description: Veil Walker. The Exalted Herald has access to Marked for Doom (Occultism) and The Grave Calls (Occultism).

item.name: Unholy Avatar
item.description: +1 Strength, +1 Armour Penetration, and Divine Attacks. The Exalted Herald has access to The Rot Within (Occultism).

item.name: Daemonic Wings
item.description: Models on foot only. The bearer gains Fly (8", 16"), Light Troops, and Swiftstride.

item.name: Idol of Spite
item.description: One use only. May be activated at the start of a Round of Combat. For the duration of that Round of Combat, the bearer gains +1 Attack Value, +1 Strength, and +1 Armour Penetration.

item.name: Dark Prelate
item.description: The bearer can cast Spectral Blades (Evocation) and Hand of Glory (Occultism) as Bound Spells with Power Level (4/8) and type Casters Unit. Hand of Glory is cast as the amplified version without performing The Sacrifice.

item.name: Luck of the Dark Gods
item.description: The bearers model gains Aegis (+1, max. 4+).

item.name: Entropic Aura
item.description: Standard and Large models only. Weapon Enchantments and Armour Enchantments carried by the bearer, models in the bearers unit, and models in units that are in base contact with the bearer are ignored.

item.name: Prized Stallion
item.description: Universal Rule. The models March Rate is set to 16".

item.name: Keeper of the Beacon
item.description: Universal Rule. After Spell Selection, the Wizard must replace one of its non-Hereditary Learned Spells with one of the following spells: - Whispers of the Veil (Evocation) - The Grave Calls (Occultism) - Wrath of God (Thaumaturgy) (only if Wizard Master) - Hellfire (Hereditary Spell)

item.name: Wings
Chimera: Wings
item.description: Universal Rule. The models March Rate is set to 16" and it gains Fly (8", 16") and Light Troops.

item.name: Additional Limbs
Wasteland Behemoth: Additional Limbs
WB: Additional Limbs
item.description: Universal Rule. The models March Rate is set to 20" and its Armour is set to 3.

item.name: Master of Destruction
item.description: The bearer can use a Shield or a Spiked Shield simultaneously with a Great Weapon or a Halberd.

item.name: Deeds not Words
item.description: Attack Attribute. The model part gains Battle Focus and Hatred when joined to one or more R&F models with Battle Fever.

item.name: Dying Embers
item.description: Attack Attribute. After using the Breath Attack, the model loses a Health Point with no saves of any kind allowed.

item.name: Primal Legend
item.description: Universal Rule. The limit of Legendary Beasts is increased to “Max. 45%". While the model is on the board, friendly units with Fly may not use Flying Movement.

item.name: Release the Hounds
item.description: Universal Rule. One use only. May be activated at the start of a friendly Player Turn (all models in a unit must activate this rule at the same time). The model gains +6" March Rate and Devastating Charge (+1 Att, +1 Str) during this Player Turn.

item.name: Master of Battle
item.description: Attack Attribute. The models maximum number of Supporting Attacks is set to 3.

item.name: Damnation
item.description: Universal Rule. The unit cannot be joined by any Characters, and it may never have more ranks than files. When the unit fails a Break Test, it does not perform the extra Close Combat Attacks from Path of the Exiled. Instead replace each model of the unit with a Wretched One model after step 8 of the Round of Combat Sequence (after taking Panic Tests): - The unit with Damnation is considered destroyed and its models are considered to be removed as casualties. - Each Wretched One model is placed in the same position and facing the same direction as the replaced model, even if the replaced model was in base contact with an enemy unit. In this case, the Wretched One model is placed in base contact with the enemy unit too. - The Wretched One models form a new unit. - The Wretched One unit follows the rules for Summoned Units, except that it ignores the Unit Spacing rule when placed on the Battlefield. - The Wretched One unit cannot perform any Combat Reforms during that Round of Combat, however the enemy units can do so as normal. - Note that the following Round of Combat is not considered the First Round of Combat for the Wretched One unit nor the enemy units it is Engaged with.

item.name: Beacon of the Dark Gods
item.description: Universal Rule. Instead of selecting spells as normal, the Wizard must select one of the following spells during Spell Selection: - Whispers of the Veil (Evocation) - The Grave Calls (Occultism) - Hellfire (Hereditary Spell)

item.name: Skinning Lash
item.description: Special Attack. A unit with at least one model with Skinning Lash can make a Sweeping Attack against a single unengaged enemy unit when passing within 1" (it does not need to and cannot move through or over that unit). The enemy unit suffers 1 hit with Strength 4 and Armour Penetration 0 for each model with Skinning Lash in the unit. A unit that loses one or more Health Points due to one or more Skinning Lash Sweeping Attack suffers −1 Discipline until the end of its next Player Turn.

item.name: Gateway
item.description: Universal Rule. At the end of each friendly Magic Phase, each Hellmaw may do one of the following: - Open a Gateway: Mark a single point on the Battlefield with a Gateway Marker. This point must be within Line of Sight and 24" of the Hellmaw, and more than 6" away from enemy units. There can never be more than 4 friendly Gateway Markers on the Battlefield (including Ominous Gateways). - Close a Gateway: Choose a friendly Gateway Marker with its centre within Line of Sight and 24" of the Hellmaw. All units within 6" of the centre of the marker suffer D6 hits with Toxic Attacks and Magical Attacks. Then remove the marker. If all friendly Hellmaws have been removed as casualties, immediately close all friendly Gateways as described above. - A friendly unit may choose to enter the Gateway if all the following conditions are met: - The unit does not contain any Gigantic models. - The unit is in contact with the centre of a friendly Gateway Marker. - All models in the unit just performed an Advance or March Move and no other model has moved since. Remove the unit from the Battlefield. The unit: 1. Is then placed back on the Battlefield within 3" of the centre of any other friendly Gateway Marker. No model can end up with its centre farther away than its March Rate from the centre of the chosen marker. 2. Must have the same formation, but may face any direction. 3. Must follow the Unit Spacing rule. 4. Suffers D6 + X hits with Toxic Attacks and Magical Attacks, distributed by the owner, where X is equal to the number of ranks in the unit. Hits distributed onto models with Hell-Forged Armour or Supernal automatically fail to wound. 5. Loses Scoring until its next Player Turn. - Only a single unit may exit the same Gateway Marker in each Player Turn.

item.name: Ominous Gateway
One Ominous Gateway
Two Ominous Gateways
item.description: Universal Rule. 0-2 per Army. At the start of step 7 of the Pre-Game Sequence (Spell Selection), for each Ominous Gateway in your army, mark a point on the Battlefield outside the opponents Deployment Zone with a Gateway Marker.

item.name: Giant See Giant Do
item.description: Universal Rule. The model gains Battle Fever.

item.name: Rage
item.description: Attack Attribute - Close Combat. Whenever the model loses a Health Point, it gains +1 Attack Value. Whenever it gains a Health Point, it suffers −1 Attack Value.

item.name: Big Brother
item.description: Universal Rule. The models Health Points are set to 8, and its base size is changed to 75x100 mm. The roll for the number of hits from its Stomp Attacks is subject to Maximised Roll.

item.name: Giant Club
item.description: Close Combat Weapon. Attacks with a Giant Club gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

item.name: Monstrous Familiar
item.description: Universal Rule. The model gains Wizard Apprentice. Instead of selecting spells as normal, it must select one of the following spells (during Spell Selection): Glory of Gold (Alchemy), Breath of Corruption (Occultism), or Hellfire (Hereditary Spell).

item.name: Tribal Warspear
item.description: Close Combat Weapon. Attacks with a Tribal Warspear gain +1 Strength and Multiple Wounds (D3, against Towering Presence). Charging enemy units in base contact with the wielder suffer −1 Agility. The wielder follows the rules for War Platforms with the following exception: it can only join Infantry units that include at least one R&F Barbarian Infantry model.
